intro: Astragalus toktjenensis, commonly known as the Taktjen milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
